definition[0]: an area of a country that elects a representative to a parliament
example[2]: He represents the Essex constituency of Epping Forest.
definition[1]: the people who live and vote in a particular area
explanation[0]: In this meaning, constituency is usually followed by a singular verb
example[3]: The constituency seems happy with its MP
example[4]: The constituency seem happy with their MP
definition[2]: any group that supports or is likely to support a politician or a political party
example[5]: The trade unions were no longer the constituency of the Labour Party alone.
